intro: Bertolonia acuminata, commonly known as the sharp-pointed bertolonia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its lance-shaped leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its flowers are often brightly colored, ranging from red to purple, attracting pollinators such as bees and birds. It is a perennial shrub that is well adapted to the Mediterranean climate of its native region.
